channel.title: Leetcode on Lisa
channel.description: Recent content in Leetcode on Lisa

item.title: 3. Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters
item.description:
Given a string s, find the length of the longest substring without duplicate characters.

Example 1:

Input: s = “abcabcbb”

Output: 3

Explanation: The answer is “abc”, with the length of 3.

item.title: 5.Longest Palindromic Substring
item.description:
Given a string s, return the longest palindromic substring in s.

Example 1:

Input: s = “babad”
Output: “bab”
Explanation: “aba” is also a valid answer.

Example 2:

Input: s = “cbbd”

item.title: 6.Zigzag Conversion
item.description: The string “PAYPALISHIRING” is written in a zigzag pattern on a given number of rows like this: (you may want to display this pattern in a fixed font for better legibility)

item.title: 7.Reverse Integer
item.description: Given a signed 32-bit integer x, return x with its digits reversed. If reversing x causes the value to go outside the signed 32-bit integer range [-231, 231 - 1], then return 0.

item.title: 8.String to Integer (atoi) leetcode java解題 附邏輯 中文
item.description:
Implement the myAtoi(string s) function, which converts a string to a 32-bit signed integer.

The algorithm for myAtoi(string s) is as follows:

Whitespace: Ignore any leading whitespace (" “).

Signedness: Determine the sign by checking if the next character is ‘-’ or ‘+’, assuming positivity if neither present.

item.title: Add Two Numbers
item.description: You are given two non-empty linked lists representing two non-negative integers. The digits are stored in reverse order, and each of their nodes contains a single digit. Add the two numbers and return the sum as a linked list.

item.title: Two Sum
item.description: 1. Two SumGiven an array of integers nums and an integer target, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target.You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice.You can return the answer in any order.Example 1:Input: nums = [2,7,11,15], target = 9Output: [0,1]Explanation: Because nums[0] + nums[1] == 9, we return [0, 1].Example 2:Input: nums = [3,2,4], target = 6Output: [1,2]Example 3:Input: nums = [3,3], target = 6Output: [0,1]
